alert.note: Alert for Bath; Elliott; Fleming; Menifee; Montgomery; Morgan; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 11:11PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Montgomery, northwestern Morgan, Bath, northern Menifee, Fleming, Rowan and Elliott Counties through 1145 PM EDT... At 1111 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Load to Cranston to near Sharpsburg. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cranston, Hays Crossing, Triplett, Munson and Hilda around 1115 PM EDT. Morehead, Christy, Gates, Rodburn, Haldeman, Clearfield and Brandy around 1120 PM EDT. Owingsville, Crix, Vale, Elliottville, Wagner Store and Pelfrey around 1125 PM EDT. Hamm, Lower Spencer, Wagner, Howards Mill, Minor, Peeled Oak, Stepstone, Craney, Fannin Valley and Farley around 1130 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Blairs Mills, Oggs Station, Walkers Crossing, Hope, Lytten, Leisure, Blaze, Wrigley, Cedar Groves, Clay Lick, Little Sandy, Yocum, Zag, Fagan, Cornwell, Rothwell and Tabor. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 113 and 148. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bath; Elliott; Fleming; Menifee; Montgomery; Morgan; Rowan
